feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: What causes a CAP projection on a DB entity to fail after accessing an external OData V2 service?
entry.content:
I have a CAP Node.js project that exposes a single service containing both:

  • Projections on local database tables

  • Projections on an external OData V2 service (via EDMX)

service BookingService {
  entity BookingStatuses as projection on my.db.ValueHelp;
  entity HCMBookingRequestView as projection on External.RequestViewSet
     {
      ..
      ..
      code,
      status: Association to ValueHelps on ValueHelps.code= code
     }
  }

What is happening?

  •  I first access BookingService/BookingStatuses ‚Üí works fine.

  • Then I access BookingService/HCMBookingRequestView ‚Üí also works.

  •  Then I again access BookingService/BookingStatuses ‚Üí Fails with:

    Error: Target BookingService.BookingStatuses cannot be resolved for service SAP_HCM

What could be causing this?

  • What makes CAP think that BookingStatuses belongs to the SAP_HCM external service?

  • How is service context resolution managed internally in CAP when both local and remote projections are used in the same service?

  • What should I check to prevent CAP from mixing up DB and external projections?

  • How can I isolate or reset the context so that local projections are always correctly resolved?

  • What‚Äôs the best practice for mixing projections on DB and remote services in the same CAP service?

Setup Details

  • CAP version: @SAP/cds 8.9.4

  • External service: SAP_HCM (OData V2, connected via EDMX + destination)

  • Local DB: SQLite (dev), HANA (prod)

Any help or guidance on how to resolve this or how to structure services to avoid this would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Add @sap/cds v8 service to existing project that uses v7 using existing db
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like to add a new UI5 application using odata v4 and an Analytical Table to our current mta application using @SAP/cds v7. 
The Analytical Table sends queries that could only be processed with  @SAP/cds v8 service, v7 gives errors like Feature is not supported: Transformation "CONCAT" with query option $apply
I would like to use the db of the existing mta application for that new service.

 Do you have any suggestion?

I have some ideas but struggling with both:

  • adding the new service to the current mta app
    • upgrading @SAP/cds - there's a lot of custom code to rewrite, not ideal
    • adding the new v8 service without upgrading @SAP/cds in the whole project, having a package.json in the new service folder with @SAP/cds v8 - not tried that yet, just came into my mind
  • creating a new app using the existing db
    • define the current db as existing service - I cannot make the xsuaa to work so far
    •  consume the existing hdi container - all the examples I found using schema name and role, but I see no option defining those for the hdi container
      e.g. https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-consume-existing-database-container-in-sap-cloud-application/ba-p/13559865
      https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hana-cloud-access-cross-container-schema.html

 Any help would be appreciated.

Best,
Peter

entry.title: cds.context.headers not updating from req.headers in CAP v9
entry.content:
We‚Äôre upgrading a CAP application from version 7.9 to 9 and noticed that cds.context.headers no longer reflects values from req.headers, which used to work in the older version.

In version 7.9, cds.context.headers was automatically populated from the request headers. After the upgrade to v9, this no longer happens ‚Äî it stays empty or outdated.

Was this behavior removed in a specific version after 7.9, or is it a bug?

Behavior comparison:

  • Version 7.9:

  • Version 9:

    •  

Any ideas if this is an intentional change or something we‚Äôre missing? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Stream with CAP Node JS
entry.content:
Hello,
I've implemented a very simplistic CAP service that sends a request to a SAP S4 backend system to retrieve a file as a stream ( .../$value)

This a simplified version of my code in the request handler function :

const results = await _sendAxiosHttpRequest(
            {
                method: "GET",
                url: "<service_path>/$value",
                headers: oHeaders,
                responseType: "stream",
                maxContentLength: Infinity,
                maxBodyLength: Infinity
            },
            <my_destination>);
    
 return [{ value: results.data,
           $mediaContentType: results.headers["content-type"],
           $mediaContentDispositionType: results.headers["content-disposition"] }];

As you can see, i send the request using Axios and in debug mode I checked that this request to the S/4 backend is successful.
results.data is an object of type IncomingMessage (which is a readable stream)
The problem is that the response generated by the CAP service contains nothing. It returns an empty response. 
Even the headers "content-type" and "content-disposition" are not set.

Do you have any Idea, why it's not working ?

Thank you for your help üôÇ

entry.title: Learning SAP BTP CAP Application
entry.content:
Hello,

I‚Äôm new to the SAP ecosystem and find it quite promising so far. My background is in traditional Java and JavaScript-based applications, and I also have experience with deployment processes.

Recently, I started exploring the SAP BTP Free Tier and attempted to develop a CAP (Cloud Application Programming) application. However, I‚Äôve been facing some difficulties‚Äîespecially with the official learning journeys and free resources, which I find hard to follow or insufficiently detailed.

My goal is to build and deploy a full-stack CAP application, and I‚Äôm looking for comprehensive, beginner-friendly guides or tutorials that can walk me through this journey from scratch. I would prefer resources that explain the core concepts thoroughly rather than just relying on plugins or auto-generated code. I want to understand and write the code myself, so I can confidently customize and maintain it later.

Additionally, I‚Äôm interested in learning SAP Fiori to build the front-end/UI for my CAP applications. However, I notice that most examples and tools auto-generate Fiori elements, which I find limiting for deeper learning.

Could you suggest:

  • The best step-by-step resources (courses, tutorials, documentation)?

  • A clear learning roadmap for mastering CAP and Fiori from scratch?

  • How to navigate or explore these tools and concepts effectively?

Any guidance or structured approach would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Navigation Issue in CAP UI5 Apps on BTP CF Fiori Launchpad After Page Refresh
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are building several CAP-based UI5 applications deployed on BTP Cloud Foundry.

When these applications run inside the Fiori Launchpad (FLP), we encounter a navigation issue: if a user refreshes the page explicitly, they are unable to navigate back using either the browser‚Äôs back button or the Launchpad‚Äôs NavBack button (next to the SAP home icon). Initially, the user remains stuck on the current page (the browser hash doesn‚Äôt change either). After a few clicks, they are suddenly redirected straight to the FLP home page.

There are no errors/warnings/info in the browser's console log.

This issue does not occur when the same UI5 apps are run in standalone mode (accessed via the HTML5 Applications tab in the BTP Cockpit), nor does it affect Fiori Elements apps running in FLP.

Here‚Äôs how we handle navigation and routing in our UI5 app view controllers (TypeScript):

Navigating Forward

// params are routing parameters such as mandatory parameter
public navToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {});
}

Example usage:

public onNavToNextView(): void {
    this.navToView("nextView");
}

We even added a nav back button, but it has the same problem as well.

Navigating Back

// same, params is just an obj for routing parameters
public navBackToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    const history = History.getInstance();
    const previousHash = history.getPreviousHash();

    if (previousHash !== undefined) {
        window.history.go(-1);
    } else {
        this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {}, true);
    }
}

Example usage:

// press event for nav back button
public onNavBack(): void {
    this.navBackToView("previousView");
}

This is how we initialise the router in the Component.ts file:

this.getRouter().initialize();

This is the routing configuration in the manifest.json file:

"routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "myapp.view",
        "async": true,
        "bypassed": {
          "target": "notFound"
        }
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteHome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": ["TargetHome"]
        },
        {
          "pattern": "login",
          "name": "login",
          "target": "login"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "TargetHome": {
          "id": "Home",
          "name": "Home",
          "level": 1
        },
        "login": {
          "viewName": "Login",
          "viewId": "login",
          "level": 1
        },
        "notFound": {
          "id": "notFound",
          "name": "NotFound",
          "transition": "show"
        }
      }
    }

 

Are we missing something in our implementation? We‚Äôve followed UI5 examples from the Demo Kit. Could this be a known or unknown issue/bug with FLP itself?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Facing CDS Compiler version issue in SAP CAP Java
entry.content:
Hello,

I am working on SAP CAP Java. had to upgrade version on only axios in package.json file. it also upgrades cds-compiler version to 6.1.0 in my package-lock.json file and now service fails saying 'CDS compiler version 6 is not supported. Please use cds-dk 8 w/ cds-compiler 5'.

I have even upgraded to the latest
@SAP/cds from 8.8.0 to 9.2.0,
@SAP/cds-dk from 8.8.0 to 9.2.0,
cds-compiler from 4.9.0 to 6.1.0.

still facing this issue in my service. except downgrading is there any other way?,  can someone help me out?

entry.title: REST APIs are working fine But my Service.js implmentations are not triggering when app is deployed
entry.content:

where i want only service to be as separate application so i have build data using CDS BUILD --PRODUCTION for deployment.

When deployement is done i wasnt able to call my action and function which are implemented in Service.js . 

i am repeating again everything is working fine in the local development. and i would deploy React app as static_buildpack as separate applicaiton and use this service of app there.

Is there anything i have missed?

Thanks & Regards

entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Does anyone have a resource/blog which will guide for accessing a Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application by using oAuth2 authentication method. Previously the approach was to use Username and Password, but that is being deprecated.

So to move towards the oAuth2 related authentication, i would like to know the steps that needs to be taken from SF admin center and also the steps needs to implemented in a CAP application to access this API based on this oAuth2 credentials. Kindly help. Thanks.

@qmacro : Kindly extend your help. Thanks.

entry.title: To set up a destination in SAP BTP for connecting to the Microsoft Azure Mail Service -Graph API
entry.content:
1. Access SAP BTP Cockpit 

  • Log into SAP BTP Cockpit: Go to SAP BTP Cockpit 
  • Navigate to Subaccount: In the subaccount of your choice (where the destination will be configured), click on the subaccount to access its settings.

2. Create a New Destination

  • Navigate to Destinations:

    • In the SAP BTP Cockpit, go to Connectivity > Destinations (under the Connectivity section in your subaccount).

    • Create New Destination:

      • Click + (Create New Destination).

      • Fill in the following fields:

3. Configure the Destination for Microsoft Graph API

     Fill in the required fields to define the destination for Microsoft Graph API:

     General Information

  • Name: Choose a descriptive name for the destination, e.g., AzureMailService.

  • Type: Select HTTP.

  • Description: Provide a brief description, e.g., "Destination for Microsoft Graph API to send transactional emails."

  • URL:  https://graph.microsoft.com/V1.0

4. Authentication Settings

  • Authentication:

    • Select OAuth2 for OAuth authentication, since Microsoft Graph API requires OAuth2 Client Credentials flow.

    • OAuth2 Client Credentials: This will be your method for obtaining access tokens to authenticate API requests.

      • OAuth2 Client ID: This is the Client ID from the Azure AD app you registered in the Azure portal.

      • OAuth2 Client Secret: This is the Client Secret generated for the Azure AD app.

      • OAuth2 Token URL: The token URL from Microsoft Identity Platform, which is:

         
        https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenantId}/oauth2/v2.0/token

        Replace {tenantId} with your actual tenant ID.

      • OAuth2 Scope: For sending emails, use the scope Mail.Send. This allows the app to send emails through Microsoft Graph API.

      • OAuth2 Grant Type: Choose Client Credentials as you're using the client credentials flow.

5.Connection Settings

  • URL: Set the URL to connect to Microsoft Graph API. The base URL for Microsoft Graph is:

     
    https://graph.microsoft.com

  • Proxy Type: If you are using a proxy, you can set it here. If not, leave it as None.

  • Additional Headers: You can add any extra headers if needed. Usually, for Microsoft Graph API, no additional headers are required apart from the authorization header, which is handled automatically by the OAuth2 configuration.

6. Test the Destination

  • Test Connectivity: After creating the destination, test it by clicking on Check Connection.

  • Successful Connection: If the connection is successful, you‚Äôll see a message confirming that the destination is reachable.

7. Secure the Destination

  • Security Considerations:

    • Make sure that only authorized users and applications have access to this destination.

    • You can use Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) to limit who can access this destination in SAP BTP.

8. Integrate the Destination into Your Application

Once the destination is configured, you can integrate it into your Node.js or CAPM application to use it for sending emails.

  • Access Destination Programmatically:

    const { retrieveJwt } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity');
    const { executeHttpRequest } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client');
    module.exports = srv => {
      srv.on('sendmail', async (req) => {
            const JWT_Token = retrieveJwt(req);    // Access the destination via JWT Secured token
        const destination = {
          destinationName: 'AzureMailService', JWT_Token
         };
      }
    }

Use Destination in API Requests: Use the executeHttpRequest method from the SAP Cloud SDK to make requests to the Microsoft Graph API, passing in the destination to authenticate the request.

Conclusion

By setting up a destination for the Microsoft Azure Mail Service in SAP BTP, you establish a secure and centralized way for your SAP applications to send transactional emails via the Microsoft Graph API. This eliminates the need for third-party email services, reduces costs, and ensures a reliable and scalable email service across your BTP landscape.

entry.title: HDI deployment error : deployed file already provides it, Could not compose a consistent make graph
entry.content:
getting this error while subscribing a new tenant to our application.

the deployed file already provides it Could not compose a consistent make graph Calculating dependencies... failed Making... failed Starting make in the container "6D29AE79357049B781C527A584B55E75" with 13 files to deploy, 0 files to undeploy... failed'' at module.exports [as _UPDATE] (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/libx/_runtime/db/generic/update.js:95:9) at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5) at async next (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/srv/srv-dispatch.js:69:17) at async HanaDatabase.handle (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/srv/srv-dispatch.js:67:10) at async retry (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds-mtxs/lib/utils.js:46:14) at async pickJob (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds-mtxs/srv/jobs-service.js:171:5)

Could you help me understand what could be the reasons getting this error ? sometimes the error doesnt show up while subscribing, but shows up while upgrading the tenant.

not sure which files to share, repo here https://github.tools.sap/one-sm/supplier-syndication

entry.title: How to trigger navigation to a specific URL from a CAP action in Fiori Elements
entry.content:
I‚Äôm using SAP CAP (Node.js, OData V4) together with a Fiori Elements V4 ListReport/ObjectPage app. I have a bound action on an entity that‚Äôs triggered by a button labeled ‚ÄúOpen Target‚Äù. When the user triggers this action, I want the app to navigate to a known Object Page route using an already prepared hash URL. I‚Äôd like to avoid adding client-side controller extensions or custom UI logic if possible. I tried sending a notification with a target URL from the CAP action, but the app does not navigate. Current behavior: The toast shows but there is no navigation, no errors. In the future, I would like to read the ID when a line is selected, the button is clicked, read the ID of the line, and then use this ID for navigation. But for now I wanted to test that with a fixed ID.
This is because it goes to a different service endpoint. my-service.js is located in /srv, where the CD files are stored.

// srv/my-service.js
module.exports = cds.service.impl(function () {
    let url = `/myapp/webapp/index.html#/TargetEntity(ID=38cf6b1a-2356-404e-b423-f4e21a6b7611,IsActiveEntity=true)`;

    req.notify({
      type: 'Success',
      message: 'Opening target‚Ä¶',
      target: url
    });

    return 'OK';
  });
});

entry.title: SAP CDS/ CAP API Reference & Documentation
entry.content:
Hello,

Is there a detailed documentation of interfaces provided by  "sap/cds" package?
Me and my teammates are struggling to find detailed API Reference for CAP for quite a long time already.
The only resource available is https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/, but it does not provide enough information on CAP class methods, method return types etc. Without such documentation developer has to either go into source code of the npm package, or spend A lot of time debugging and testing ootb interfaces to understand what they can & can not do.
If anybody knows a page with detailed reference of each API provided by CAP - kindly share it, it will be much appreciated.

Here's an example of such documentation - API reference for MongoDB Node.js driver.
https://mongodb.github.io/node-mongodb-native/Next/modules.html

 

Regards,
Alex

entry.title: Python support in CAP based Application
entry.content: I know there is no support for python programming language in CAP. But due to recent advancements in AI, is there any plan to support python programming language in CAP considering most AI experts prefer working with python? If yes, is there any timeline that we can follow?

entry.title: Unable to deploy a CAP app
entry.content:
I created an app based on a local CAP project. I tried to deploy the app to BTP build workzone, but I am getting an error when I execute the command cds add workzone. This was working last month and I was able to deploy the app properly last time with the same steps. 

Error message: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'inbounds')

I have attached the screenshot of the error. I tried downgrading and updating the cds dk version and I still got the same issue.

Thanks,

Siva

entry.title: setup environment for dev,qa,prod in capm
entry.content: I‚Äôm currently working on a CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model) application and would like to understand the best practices for managing and maintaining multiple environments  as Development, Quality Assurance (QA), and Production.

entry.title: CAP application handling of innererror returned from SAP OData
entry.content:
Hello,

Sorry we are writing with such simple case but we can't find a good solution for it.

What we did is we created OData v2 in SAP backend. We created CAP (node.js) application which consume this OData and expose it as OData v4 (with small changes in entity fields).

In CAP application we are forwarding requests to backend using this command:

srv.on(["READ"], "EquipmentTimeSegment", async (request) => {
return services.equipment_srv.tx(request).run(request.query);
});

We deployed application with "production" profile to CloudFoundry.

While using application we noticed that when there is error returned from SAP with innererror details it is not returned by CAP application. We only get status 502 - exception during request. No details at all what happend.

 

Is there any standard CAP handler for it? Any settings we need to do to receive full error response from SAP on "production" profile?

Can someone advice something?

entry.title: BTP CAP ‚Äì OData V4 metadata auto-updates with new fields, but V2 does not?
entry.content:
Odata v4:-

Odata v2:-


In my CAPM project on BTP, I see that when I add new fields, the OData V4 service metadata updates automatically. But in OData V2, the metadata stays unchanged unless regenerated. Why does this difference occur and how should I handle it?

entry.title: Is it possible make a CAP Application consume events from EMIS (Integration Suite Event Mesh) ?
entry.content:
Hi CAP community.

I am trying to leverage EMIS (Integration Suite's Event Mesh capability) within a CAP v9 Application. I am following this great video of @ajmaradiaga along side with CAP's documentation (which is not specific to EMIS, but to Standalone Event Mesh service). 

I have successfully set up a queue + topic subscription in EMIS which is receiving events from S/4HANA Public Cloud. I created a service instance of SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh (message-client plan) to provide the credentials to the CAP application (and S4), and bound it both in .cdsrc and mta to feed them at runtime. This is working.

So far so good,  but here is the twist: the bound credentials of the EMIS service don't contain the 'management' object that CAP's messaging service implementation is expecting. See the below error, which is what I am hitting after starting the cap server using

"kind": enterprise-messaging  (or -shared)

options.credentials is correctly bound to EMIS client service key, but no management object exist

I know that when you create an instance of the Standalone SAP Event Mesh service, the keys contain this management object, as stated in the 'documentation'. However, the binding to the EMIS Message Client doesn't:

This makes me wonder: is CAP prepared to integrate with Integration Suite's Event Mesh, or not yet? (CAP documentation doesn't mention this specific use case).

Is there something wrong within my set up?

 

Any help or clue is well appreciated!

Lucho

entry.title: Headers missing from CAP request in handler
entry.content:
Hi All!

I'm working on a CAP service that serves content to both an HTML5 app and an MDK app. I've created a handler to pre-filter some data according to the user ID. If the user is logged in using the MDK app, I want to detect this using the header' x-forwarded-path', which should be included in the request (I implemented this in another project successfully).

But this time, using CAP 8.9.2, I see only the x-correlation-id header in any request; a lot is missing. I saw some posts about missing authorisation headers, but not all the other headers (x-*** for example). 

My packages:

    "@sap/cds": "^8.9.2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^8.9.1",
    "@sap/xsenv": "^5.5.0",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4.6.0",

Has anyone here been through this before?

Thanks!
